children.subject: are concurrent enrollment students eligible for CS 189 Academic Intern Positions?
Is being an AI for 189 a requirement (to any extent) to become a TA/Reader in the future?

history.content:
On behalf of the Fall 2019 CS 189 staff, I invite you to apply for our Academic Intern role.

 

Becoming an Academic Intern is a great way to reinforce what you've learned, help students (as you were helped), become a better teacher, and keep in touch with the community. Furthermore, academic interning is one of the first steps you can take if you're interested in reading or TA’ing in the future. This semester, academic interns will be responsible for creating problems for and hosting CS 189 Guerrilla Sections, allowing them to develop skills highly desired in a CS 189 TA - logistics experience, a passion for the material, and a desire to go above and beyond. Please note that academic interning requires you to be responsible and hard-working, which is why we require you to enroll in either 1 or 2 pass/no pass units.

Furthermore, starting this semester, Academic Interns will be required to be enrolled in CS 197, a mandatory 1 unit bCourses online section, which will require ~20-30 minutes of work each week, composed of readings and reflections. This requirement will be in addition to the original responsibilities of academic interns.

 

The deadline for the application is Friday September 6th. You may find it here: https://forms.gle/t24uf8qis1bbEy9cA
